aboutUs.title: About Us
aboutUs.visionText1: IDA (Intelligence Data Analytics) was born from a passion for football and the belief that technology and data can revolutionize this sport in Côte d'Ivoire.
aboutUs.visionText2: Our mission is simple: provide clubs, coaches, and agents with advanced analytical tools to improve performance, identify talent, and maximize opportunities in the football world.
aboutUs.missionText1: Transform Ivorian football through data analytics
aboutUs.missionText2: Provide cutting-edge tools for performance optimization
aboutUs.value1Text: We constantly push technological boundaries to offer the best data analysis solutions.
aboutUs.value2Text: Our love for football drives every decision and innovation we make.
aboutUs.value3Text: We are committed to delivering the highest quality in everything we do.

contactUs.title: Contact Us
contactUs.formTitle: You can also send us a message directly by filling out the form below
contactUs.name: Name
contactUs.subject: Subject
contactUs.errorMessage: Failed to send message. Please try again.

homePage.heroSubtitle: We are redefining the future of football in Côte d'Ivoire through advanced sports data exploitation.
homePage.briefSubtitle: Our project focuses on collecting and analyzing precise and detailed data, directly from matches.
homePage.feature1Text: We use the latest AI camera technologies to capture every moment of the game, enabling in-depth analysis of player and team performance. These innovative tools offer a unique overview, capturing angles impossible to obtain through traditional means.
homePage.feature2Text: Our expert teams transform this data into actionable insights, providing clubs, coaches, and agents with precise insights to improve game strategies, optimize player performance, and identify promising talent.
homePage.feature3Text: Whether you're a club looking for a competitive advantage, an agent wanting to spot the next great talent, or a football enthusiast eager to understand the game from a new angle,
homePage.feature3Text2: Discover how the power of data can transform Ivorian football.
homePage.whatIsIDASubtitle: IDA is an innovative project dedicated to collecting, analyzing, and exploiting sports data in Côte d'Ivoire, primarily in football
homePage.visionTitle: A Vision to Transform Football in Côte d'Ivoire
homePage.visionText: Together, we share a common vision: elevate football in Côte d'Ivoire to a new level through innovation and data.
homePage.joinAdventureTitle: Join us in this IDA adventure today.
homePage.joinAdventureText1: Explore our site to learn more about our services, technological solutions, and how we can collaborate to elevate football in Côte d'Ivoire to a higher level
homePage.joinAdventureText2: Together, we can create an ecosystem where data and technology enable pushing the limits of what's possible in Ivorian football.

footer.discoverPower: Discover how the power of data can transform Ivorian football.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.a1: IDA (Intelligence Data Analytics) is an innovative project dedicated to collecting, analyzing, and exploiting sports data in Côte d'Ivoire, particularly in football. We use AI-powered smart cameras to capture accurate data from matches, providing in-depth analysis for clubs, coaches, and agents.
faq.q2: How do IDA's AI cameras work?
faq.a2part1: The cameras are advanced video recording devices equipped with artificial intelligence, capable of capturing the entire field without requiring an operator.
faq.a2part2: They analyze player movements in real-time, automatically identifying key moments in the game, enabling detailed analysis afterwards.
faq.q3: What types of data can you collect?
faq.a3part1: We collect a variety of data, including individual player statistics, field positions, passes, shots, performance, as well as teams' strategic data.
faq.a3part2: This information is then analyzed to provide detailed reports.
faq.a4: Our services are aimed at football clubs, coaches, agents, recruiters, and any football professional seeking to exploit data to improve performance, identify talent, or refine game strategies.
faq.q5: How can I access match analyses?
faq.a5: Match analyses are accessible via our online platform. Clubs and other partners can log in to view reports, download data, and obtain personalized insights according to their needs.
faq.q6: What are the benefits of using IDA for my club?
faq.a6part1: Using IDA services allows you to obtain a detailed and objective view of your team's performance. You can identify your players' strengths and weaknesses, adjust your strategies accordingly, and improve your chances of success on the field.
faq.a6part2: Additionally, the collected data can also be used to showcase your players to international recruiters and agents.
faq.a7: Yes, we offer tailor-made services according to each client's specific needs. Whether you need specific analysis for a match or continuous monitoring throughout the season, we can adapt our services to your requirements.
faq.q8: How can I register to use your services?
faq.a8part1: To register for our services, you can visit the
faq.a8part2: page on our website or contact us directly via our
faq.a8part3: page. Our team will guide you through the process and provide you with all the necessary information.
faq.q9: Do your services only cover Ivorian teams?
faq.a9: No, although our project is focused on developing football in Côte d'Ivoire, we are open to collaborating with football clubs and organizations in other countries.
faq.q10: How can I contact you for more information?
faq.a10part1: You can contact us via our
faq.a10part2: page on the site, or by email at
faq.a10part3: We will be happy to answer all your questions

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.subtitle: INTELLIGENCE DATA AGENCY (IDA)
privacyPolicy.intro: This Privacy Policy describes how BRAINCI SARL collects, uses, protects and shares personal data of users of the Ivoirian Data Agency (IDA) service. It applies to all uses of the platform (web, mobile, API, partner tools).
privacyPolicy.section1Text: BRAINCI SARL, a limited liability company under Ivorian law, with a capital of 1,000,000 FCFA, registered with RCCM CI-ABJ-03-2023-B12-01834, headquartered in Abidjan Cocody Bonoumin, is responsible for processing personal data collected on the IDA platform.
privacyPolicy.section2Intro: IDA collects personal data directly from users (forms, accounts, registrations) and indirectly (cookies, technical logs, analytical data).
privacyPolicy.section2Subtitle: The main categories of data collected include:
privacyPolicy.section2Item1: Identification data: name, first name, email, telephone, account identifiers;
privacyPolicy.section2Item2: Connection data: IP addresses, logs, session identifiers;
privacyPolicy.section2Item3: Payment data (B2C): transaction references, secure payment methods;
privacyPolicy.section2Item4: Sports and multimedia data: videos, statistics, performance, player identifiers (within authorized contractual framework).
privacyPolicy.section3Item1: enable the provision and management of the Service;
privacyPolicy.section3Item2: ensure the security and maintenance of the Service;
privacyPolicy.section3Item5: comply with legal obligations, particularly tax and data retention requirements.
privacyPolicy.section4Item2: the legitimate interest of BRAINCI SARL to ensure the security and proper functioning of the Service;
privacyPolicy.section4Item3: explicit consent for certain features (cookies, newsletters, marketing).
privacyPolicy.section5Text: Data may be transmitted to technical service providers (hosting, cloud services, payment tools, technical support) acting on behalf of BRAINCI SARL and subject to strict confidentiality and security obligations.
privacyPolicy.section6Text: Data may be hosted or processed abroad, including outside Côte d'Ivoire, in compliance with local laws and contractual clauses ensuring an equivalent level of protection.
privacyPolicy.section7Intro: Personal data is retained for the period strictly necessary to achieve the purposes, mainly:
privacyPolicy.section7Item1: Account data: usage period + 3 years after deletion;
privacyPolicy.section7Item2: Payment data: legal accounting retention period;
privacyPolicy.section8Intro: In accordance with Ivorian legislation and GDPR, users have the following rights:
privacyPolicy.section8Item5: right to withdraw consent at any time.
privacyPolicy.section8Footer: Requests can be sent by email to dpo@brainci.org, accompanied by valid identification.
privacyPolicy.section9Text: BRAINCI SARL implements appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure the security and confidentiality of data (encryption, backups, firewalls, strong authentication). However, no system is completely invulnerable.
privacyPolicy.section10Text: IDA uses functional, analytical and audience measurement cookies. Users can configure their browser to block non-essential cookies or manage their preferences via the cookie banner.
privacyPolicy.section11Text: Use of the Service by minors is subject to authorization from a legal guardian. BRAINCI SARL does not intentionally collect data from minors without consent.
privacyPolicy.section12Text: BRAINCI SARL may modify this Privacy Policy. Users will be informed of changes by email, notification or banner on the site. The current version is always available at https://
privacyPolicy.section13Intro: For any questions regarding privacy or exercising your rights:
privacyPolicy.section13Address: Address: Cocody Bonoumin, lot 1641, ilot 57 – 08 BP 1094 Abidjan 08

termsConditions.title: Terms & Conditions
termsConditions.subtitle: INTELLIGENCE DATA AGENCY (IDA)
termsConditions.editorText: The "Ivoirian Data Agency (IDA)" Service is a platform published and operated by BRAINCI SARL (hereinafter "BRAINCI"), a limited liability company (SARL) under Ivorian law.
termsConditions.companyName: Company name: BRAINCI; Type: SARL; Share capital: 1,000,000 FCFA.
termsConditions.headquarters: Headquarters: Abidjan, Cocody Municipality, Bonoumin District, Lot 1641, Block 57.
termsConditions.taxInfo: Taxpayer account number: 2301525Y; CDI Code: 063; Activity code: SC60802.
termsConditions.additionalRefs: Additional references (legal notice / notarial office): registry filing No. 24085/GTCA/RC/2023 dated 23/03/2023 and legal notice published on 31/03/2023 (Fraternité Matin).
termsConditions.importantNote: Important: in case of discrepancy between administrative references, the RCCM extract or any official document issued by the competent authority prevails.
termsConditions.publicationDirector: Publication Director: [Name and title to be completed].
termsConditions.hostingText: The Service is hosted by: [Host name + address + country to be completed].
termsConditions.hostingNote: When video content is provided, it may be stored and distributed via technical service providers (CDN/streaming) indicated in the Legal Information.
termsConditions.section1Text: These Terms of Use aim to define the conditions of access and use of the IDA Service, as well as the rights and obligations of BRAINCI and Users. IDA is accessible in B2C mode (individual users) and B2B (clubs, academies, federations, media, agents, recruiters, sponsors, partners, etc.). Any use of the Service implies unreserved acceptance of these Terms.
termsConditions.section2Service: "Service": the website, mobile application, interfaces, dashboards, APIs (if applicable) and more generally any IDA environment.
termsConditions.section2User: "User": any natural or legal person accessing the Service, whether Visitor (without Account) or Account holder.
termsConditions.section2Account: "Account": personal/professional space allowing access to features (free and/or paid).
termsConditions.section2Content: "Content": all elements accessible via the Service (statistics, data, reports, texts, images, videos, excerpts, interfaces, etc.).
termsConditions.section2SportsData: "Sports Data": information relating to sporting events (matches/training), including game events, performance indicators, metadata, analyses, and any processing results.
termsConditions.section2Videos: "Videos": full recordings, excerpts, sequences, replays, clips, and/or streams, when available on the Service.
termsConditions.section2Offer: "Offer": any free or paid access (subscription, package, service, license) offered by BRAINCI.
termsConditions.section3Item1: (i) collection and/or aggregation of Sports Data (human input, sensors, AI cameras, source files, APIs, etc.);
termsConditions.section3Item2: (ii) processing and visualization (dashboards, statistics, comparisons, reports, exports);
termsConditions.section3Item3: (iii) hosting and provision of video content (matches, excerpts, analyses) when this feature is activated;
termsConditions.section3Item4: (iv) B2B services: multi-account licenses, team access, advanced exports, integrations and/or APIs, on-site services;
termsConditions.section3Item5: (v) B2C services: individual access to certain Sports Data and/or Videos according to the subscribed Offer.
termsConditions.section3Note: The exact scope depends on the Offer. BRAINCI may evolve the Service in accordance with Article 19.
termsConditions.section4_1Text: The Service is accessible via the Internet. Some features require Account creation.
termsConditions.section4_2Text: The User undertakes to provide accurate, complete and up-to-date information.
termsConditions.section4_3Text: Credentials are strictly personal. Any action performed from the Account is deemed to be performed by the User.
termsConditions.section4_4Text: In case of suspected fraudulent use, BRAINCI may temporarily suspend access to protect the User and the Service.
termsConditions.section5_1Text: Access is strictly personal (unless otherwise stated) and limited to private use.
termsConditions.section5_2Text: Access may be granted to multiple internal users of the same organization according to the Offer. The B2B Client is responsible for the use of accounts linked to their organization.
termsConditions.section5_3Text: In B2B offers, an "Administrator" account can manage access, authorizations and usage settings.
termsConditions.section6_1Text: Prices, durations, renewal terms, quotas and included features are described on the Service and/or in commercial conditions (GTC, contract, purchase order).
termsConditions.section6_2Text: Any amount due is payable according to the indicated methods (online payment, transfer, mobile money, etc.).
termsConditions.section6_3Text: In case of delay or payment incident, BRAINCI may suspend paid access without prejudice to any collection action.
termsConditions.section6_4Text: A B2B contract may prevail over these Terms in case of contradiction.
termsConditions.section7Text: If the User is a consumer and a right of withdrawal is applicable under current regulations, the terms are specified in the B2C GTC. When the User requests immediate access to digital content (e.g., access to premium Sports Data, Videos, exports) before the end of the legal period, they may be required to expressly acknowledge that they waive their right of withdrawal, in accordance with the B2C GTC and applicable regulations.
termsConditions.section8Item1: a) to compromise the security or integrity of the Service (intrusion, bypass, exploit, denial of service, etc.);
termsConditions.section8Item2: b) to extract or massively scrape Data (scraping), reconstruct a database, or use unauthorized robots;
termsConditions.section8Item3: c) to bypass access restrictions, quotas, payment, or rights (DRM/access control);
termsConditions.section8Item4: d) to resell, publish or make Content available to third parties beyond the rights granted by the Offer;
termsConditions.section8Item5: e) to disseminate unlawful content or infringing third party rights (defamation, hate, privacy violation, etc.).
termsConditions.section8Note: In case of breach, BRAINCI may apply the measures provided in Article 18.
termsConditions.section9Title: 9. Sports Data, Videos and Rights – liability framework
termsConditions.section9_1Text: Sports Data and analyses constitute information and decision-support tools. BRAINCI does not guarantee any sporting, economic or recruitment results.
termsConditions.section9_2Text: Capture and processing may be affected by technical constraints (network, camera angle, unavailability, input errors, etc.). BRAINCI does not guarantee completeness.
termsConditions.section9_3Text: When data comes from third parties, it remains subject to the rights and conditions of these third parties.
termsConditions.section10Title: 10. Image Rights, Video Capture and Broadcasting
termsConditions.section10_1Text: Broadcasting Videos and images of identifiable persons (players, staff, referees, spectators) involves respecting image rights, privacy and necessary authorizations.
termsConditions.section10_2Text: Any B2B Client (club/organizer) that provides, requests or authorizes the capture and/or online posting of content guarantees that they have the required rights and authorizations (including competition authorizations, stadium, player/staff agreements and, where applicable, consents).
termsConditions.section10_3Text: Depending on the Offer, certain content may be private, shared or public. The User is responsible for the sharing settings they activate.
termsConditions.section10_4Text: Any person believing that content infringes their rights may report it in accordance with Article 17.
termsConditions.section11_1Text: The Service, its interface, code, trademarks, logos, graphic elements, and documentation are protected by intellectual property law.
termsConditions.section11_2Text: Compilations of Sports Data and their structure may be protected under database rights.
termsConditions.section11_3Text: Any unauthorized reproduction, representation, adaptation, substantial extraction, or distribution is prohibited.
termsConditions.section12Text: BRAINCI grants the User a personal (or internal for B2B), non-exclusive, non-transferable license, limited to the duration of the Offer, to use the Service in accordance with these Terms and the conditions of the subscribed Offer. Unless expressly permitted (export, sharing, API), the User may not redistribute Content to third parties.
termsConditions.section13_1Text: The User remains responsible for the content they transmit (match sheets, information, videos, comments, etc.).
termsConditions.section13_2Text: The User grants BRAINCI a non-exclusive license allowing hosting, technical reproduction, indexing, technical transformation (encoding), analysis and display, strictly as necessary for the provision of the Service.
termsConditions.section13_3Text: In case of content withdrawal or deletion, residual copies may remain in technical backups for a limited period.
termsConditions.section14Text: When the B2B User accesses non-public information (internal reports, team analyses, private videos), they undertake to: (i) keep them strictly confidential; (ii) limit their access to authorized personnel; (iii) not use them outside the purposes provided by the Offer or B2B contract.
termsConditions.section15_1Text: BRAINCI processes certain personal data (account creation, logs, security, support, billing).
termsConditions.section15_2Text: The purposes, legal bases, retention periods and rights of individuals are described in the Privacy Policy accessible on the Service.
termsConditions.section15_3Text: The Service may use cookies/trackers. The terms are set out in the Cookie Policy.
termsConditions.section16Text: BRAINCI implements reasonable security measures (access controls, backups, monitoring, etc.). The User must protect their credentials, keep their equipment up to date and report any incident.
termsConditions.section17_1Text: Any User or third party may report content deemed unlawful or infringing their rights (image rights, privacy, copyright, defamation, etc.).
termsConditions.section17_2Text: The report must include: (i) the URL or reference of the content, (ii) the subject of the request, (iii) supporting evidence, (iv) the applicant's contact details.
termsConditions.section17_3Text: BRAINCI examines the request and may, as appropriate, limit access, remove content, or request additional information.
termsConditions.section18_1Text: In case of violation of the Terms, BRAINCI may: warn, limit certain functions, temporarily suspend, or terminate the Account.
termsConditions.section18_2Text: In case of non-payment, immediate suspension of paid access until regularization.
termsConditions.section18_3Text: Termination ends the license to use. Confidentiality and intellectual property obligations survive.
termsConditions.section19Text: BRAINCI may modify the Service (addition, deletion or modification of features) and update the Terms. Users are informed by any reasonable means. Use of the Service after update constitutes acceptance.
termsConditions.section20_1Text: The Service is provided "as is" and "as available".
termsConditions.section20_2Text: BRAINCI is not liable for indirect damages (loss of opportunity, revenue, reputation, etc.).
termsConditions.section20_3Text: Except for gross negligence or willful misconduct, BRAINCI's total liability is limited to the amount actually paid by the User during the last three (3) months (or, for a single service, to the amount of said service).
termsConditions.section21Text: Neither party may be held liable in case of force majeure or event beyond its control (operator failure, power outage, administrative decision, disturbances, disaster, etc.).
termsConditions.section22Text: These Terms are governed by Ivorian law. In case of dispute, the parties will seek an amicable solution. Failing that, the competent courts of Abidjan will have sole jurisdiction, unless otherwise required by mandatory provisions.
termsConditions.section23Text: These Terms come into force on the date indicated in the header.
